availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Blanton Duncan (Louisville 2nd district prov govt rep)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, planter, attorney, and member of the provisional government. Kentucky native. Son of Garnett Duncan. Married to Mary T. Duncan. Father of Mary A. Duncan, Pattie Duncan, Jessie Duncan, Kate B. Duncan, and Georgette Duncan, Planter in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville, Kentucky, in November 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Battalion Infantry (C.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel from October 14, 1861 to May 14, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 120.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 14, p. 30 of microfilm.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 7, p. 47B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 2, 34-5.
